commands.name: az devcenter admin network-connection create
commands.syntax:
az devcenter admin network-connection create --domain-join-type {AzureADJoin, HybridAzureADJoin, None}
                                             --name
                                             --resource-group
                                             --subnet-id
                                             [--domain-name]
                                             [--domain-password]
                                             [--domain-username]
                                             [--location]
                                             [--networking-resource-group-name]
                                             [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--organization-unit]
                                             [--tags]
examples: az devcenter admin network-connection create --location "eastus" --domain-join-type "HybridAzureADJoin" --domain-name "mydomaincontroller.local" --domain-password "Password value for user" --domain-username "testuser@mydomaincontroller.local" --subnet-id "/subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/ExampleRG/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/ExampleVNet/subnets/default" --name "uswest3network" --resource-group "rg1"

commands.name: az devcenter admin network-connection delete
commands.syntax:
az devcenter admin network-connection delete [--ids]
                                             [--name]
                                             [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--resource-group]
                                             [--subscription]
                                             [--yes]

commands.name: az devcenter admin network-connection list-outbound-network-dependencies-endpoint
commands.summary: List the endpoints that agents may call as part of Dev Box service administration. These FQDNs should be allowed for outbound access in order for the Dev Box service to function.

commands.name: az devcenter admin network-connection run-health-check
commands.summary: Triggers a new health check run. The execution and health check result can be tracked via the network Connection health check details.
commands.syntax:
az devcenter admin network-connection run-health-check [--ids]
                                                       [--name]
                                                       [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                       [--resource-group]
                                                       [--subscription]

commands.name: az devcenter admin network-connection update
commands.syntax:
az devcenter admin network-connection update [--domain-name]
                                             [--domain-password]
                                             [--domain-username]
                                             [--ids]
                                             [--name]
                                             [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--organization-unit]
                                             [--resource-group]
                                             [--subnet-id]
                                             [--subscription]
                                             [--tags]
examples: az devcenter admin network-connection update --domain-password "New Password value for user" --name "networkConnection" --resource-group "rg1"

commands.name: az devcenter admin network-connection wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
